TopicTitle: Some of the Curiosity Team love playing KSP

Articles.Content:
Just read an article on CNET about a Q&A session with the Curiosity Rover team. One bit of Trivia they revealed was that a few of the team love playing KSP, nice one dev team ;-)

Also sorry I don't have the link I am on my phone. I am sure someone can find it if people want it.

Just read an article on CNET about a Q&A session with the Curiosity Rover team. One bit of Trivia they revealed was that a few of the team love playing KSP, nice one dev team ;-)

Also sorry I don't have the link I am on my phone. I am sure someone can find it if people want it.

Here you go.

http://news.cnet.com/8301-1023_3-57495117-93/mars-curiosity-rover-team-prefers-macs-to-pcs/

Oh SNAP! A mention on CNET and in the subheader at that!

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Already a thread about this, although only the reddit post in particular. Although, it still remains awesome.

Not completely related, but there was another feature on IGN the other day, was some of its team doing a lets play. Had a picture of a kerbal on the video icon on the main page for all to see. Always cool to get an idea of just how much this is spreading!
I gave the reddit a quick skim read the one that stood out for me was someone asked Startrek or Starwars NASA guys said Stargate. and that few of them watched startrek TNG
Hopefully KSP becoming famous won't ruin the community...

Hopefully KSP becoming famous won't ruin the community...

I sure am doing my best to keep the riff-raff out.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
